rationale: The agent's change is fundamentally incorrect and incomplete. The task requires adding capability checks to guard inlinestats tests in release builds. The ground truth accomplishes this by: (1) creating a randomStats() helper method that checks INLINESTATS_SUPPORTS_REMOTE capability and returns either 'STATS' or 'INLINESTATS' accordingly, (2) replacing all randomFrom('STATS', 'INLINESTATS') calls with randomStats(), and (3) adding assumeTrue guards to two specific test methods. The agent instead modified the capability definition itself in EsqlCapabilities.java, changing INLINESTATS_SUPPORTS_REMOTE from an always-enabled capability to one guarded by EsqlPlugin.INLINESTATS_FEATURE_FLAG. This is the wrong approach because: (a) it changes the capability system rather than guarding the tests, (b) it doesn't add any test guards or helper methods, (c) it modifies production code when the task requires test code changes, and (d) it completely misses all 4 test files that need modifications. The agent demonstrated poor understanding of the requirement, changed 0 of 4 required test files, and made an inappropriate production code change that could affect system behavior beyond just tests.
